result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynda M. VICK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance (Alprazolam), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law, on count 5 only.

Additional eight (8) days jail, under the Huber Law, on count 5 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

records.addlTxt: Correspondence from Attorney Kaminsky with attached letters from Beth Acker, Aaron Bertling and Chris Inyart.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 02-26-2016 at 1:30 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Preliminary held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
Exhibit #1 - list of defendant's prescribed medications.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charges contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Settlement conference with the District Attorney set for 02-04-2016 at 10:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-22-15 at 3:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.
The petition is denied because the court finds the person is not indigent.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Notice to defendant.
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC, possess schedule IV drug and 2 counts possess schedule II drug.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs except those prescribed to her. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
